title: spack create -r <repos> <url>: absolute path is required if <url> is specified
body:
In spack 0.10.0, option `-r` requires an absolute repos path if an url is given.  For example, with 'cbc' repository:
```sh
$ ls -l cbc/repo.yaml
-rw-r--r-- 1 henrik cbc 24 Jan 22 11:36 cbc/repo.yaml
```
using relative path `./cbc/`, gives an error if URL is provided:
```sh
$ spack create -r ./cbc/ https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz
==> This looks like a URL for bedops-linux-x86-64
==> Found 1 version of bedops-linux-x86-64:
  
  2.4.20  https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz2

How many would you like to checksum? (default is 1, q to abort) 
==> Downloading...
==> Fetching https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Checksummed 1 version of bedops-linux-x86-64
==> Warning: Unable to detect a build system. Using a generic package template.
==> Created template for bedops-linux-x86-64 package
==> Error: No repo.yaml found in './cbc/'
```
whereas it does work if the URL is _not_ provided:
```sh
$ spack create -r ./cbc/                                                                                               
==> Created template for example package
==> Created package file: /cbc/GitHub/sysadm-cluster/cbc/shared/apps/spack-repositories/cbc/packages/example/package.pyx86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz
```
or if the absolute path is given:
```sh
spack create -r $(pwd)/cbc/ https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz2
==> This looks like a URL for bedops-linux-x86-64
==> Found 1 version of bedops-linux-x86-64:
  
  2.4.20  https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz2

How many would you like to checksum? (default is 1, q to abort) 
==> Downloading...
==> Fetching https://github.com/bedops/bedops/releases/download/v2.4.20/bedops_linux_x86_64-v2.4.20.v2.tar.bz2
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Checksummed 1 version of bedops-linux-x86-64
==> Warning: Unable to detect a build system. Using a generic package template.
==> Created template for bedops-linux-x86-64 package
==> Created package file: /home/henrik/apps/spack-repositories/cbc/packages/bedops-linux-x86-64/package.py
```

My guess is that the working directory is changed when that check for `repo.yaml` is made.


Also, it is not clear from `spack create --help` that `-r` takes a path; I was first trying with the name of repo `namespace` (as given by `repo.yaml`), cf. `spack repo list` => (name, abs-path).
